MS MCQs

    Understand common concepts in Rust

    »

    1. Which of the following statements is incorrect?

      In Rust, variables are immutable by default.

      All integer types can be either positive or negative.

      Tuples can contain elements of different types.

      Arrays and vectors can only hold values from a single type.


    2. Which data structure would be the best fit for representing an address book that associates people’s names to their phone numbers?

      A tuple

      A vector

      An array

      A hash map


    3. What would happen if you tried to directly access an element of a vector whose index was beyond that vector’s boundaries?

      The program would panic in runtime.

      A null value would be returned.

      A compilation error would occur.

      The last element of this vector would be returned instead.
